revised_title: Enamel Development in Elasmobranch Fishes: A Comparative Study
tldr: This article examines the structure and development of the enamel in Elasmobranch fishes, comparing it to mammalian enamel. The author argues that the enamel in Elasmobranch fishes is a joint product of the epiblastic enamel organ and the mesoblastic dentine papilla, and that it has unique characteristics that set it apart from mammalian enamel. The study provides insights into the evolution of enamel and its development in different species.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Comparative Anatomy
